msItem.note: Side 1: 7 lines written on the flesh side; ample left and bottom margins
Side 2: 7 lines written on the hair side; ample right and bottom margins
Upright, medium-size uncials in a brown ink
Omega is written shallow and high in the line (cf. P.Oxy. 847)
End of 4:24 and beginning of 5:1 are missing at top of side 2; Grenfell and Hunt estimate the lacuna at 11 lines, in which case the leaf would have been about 15.5 cm long.

supportDesc.support: 7.3 x 6.5 cm. One oblong fragment of a leaf from a parchment codex, being the bottom corner of that leaf; a very few small holes; some discoloration at edges.

provenance.p: Excavated by Grenfell and Hunt for the Egypt Exploration Fund (year unknown); donated to Princeton Theological Seminary in 1915 through an arrangement with Prof. William Park Armstrong.

div.ab: [Side 1:] the Red Sea, which the Lord our God dried up before us until we crossed over, so that all the nations of the earth might know that the power of the Lord is strong... [Side 2:] that the Lord God dried up the Jordan River from before the children of Israel while they crossed over, and their intentions were melted, and they were terrified

listBibl.bibl: P.Oxy. 9.1168 A. Rahlfs, Verzeichnis der griechischen Handschriften des Alten Testamentsm (Berlin, 1914), 356; J. van Haelst, Catalogue des papyrus littÈraires juifs et chrÈtiens (Paris, 1976), 64.
